metadata.title: CVE-2023-50387 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Certain DNSSEC aspects of the DNS protocol (in RFC 4033, 4034, 4035, 6840,and related RFCs) allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPUconsumption) via one or more DNSSEC responses, aka the "KeyTrap" issue. Oneof the concerns is that, when there is a zone with many DNSKEY and RRSIGrecords, the protocol specification implies that an algorithm must evaluateall combinations of DNSKEY and RRSIG records.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-50387` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.18.18-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
bind9-dnsutils - 1:9.18.18-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
bind9-host - 1:9.18.18-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
bind9-libs - 1:9.18.18-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
bind9-utils - 1:9.18.18-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
bind9utils - 1:9.18.18-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
dnsutils - 1:9.18.18-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
No subscription required

libunbound8 - 1.13.1-1ubuntu5.4
python3-unbound - 1.13.1-1ubuntu5.4
unbound - 1.13.1-1ubuntu5.4
unbound-anchor - 1.13.1-1ubuntu5.4
unbound-host - 1.13.1-1ubuntu5.4
No subscription required

dnsmasq - 2.90-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
dnsmasq-base - 2.90-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
dnsmasq-base-lua - 2.90-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
dnsmasq-utils - 2.90-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.18.18-0ubuntu0.22.04.2').
bind9-libs package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
unbound package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.13.1-1ubuntu5.4').
dnsmasq package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.90-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
pdns-recursor package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
knot-resolver package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
